glsa.title: stunnel: Security bypass
glsa.synopsis: stunnel does not properly prevent the authentication of a revoked certificate which would be published by OCSP.

background.p: The stunnel program is designed to work as an SSL encryption wrapper between a remote client and a local or remote server. OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol), as described in RFC 2560, is an internet protocol used for obtaining the revocation status of an X.509 digital certificate.

description.p: An unspecified bug in the OCSP search functionality of stunnel has been discovered.

impact.p: A remote attacker can use a revoked certificate that would be successfully authenticated by stunnel. This issue only concerns the users who have enabled the OCSP validation in stunnel.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
